body_html:
@simonm3 you dont have 72 cores or 72 processors. It's likely you have 72 hyperthreads, and actually have 36 cores, spread across 2 process (each processor having 18 cores each).

Try setting these environment variables and see if this helps:

# in your terminal, before running python / pytorch
NUM_CORES=18
export MKL_NUM_THREADS=$NUM_CORES OMP_NUM_THREADS=$NUM_CORES
python [your program]

Try the values 9, 18, 36 for NUM_CORES

body:
@simonm3 you dont have 72 cores or 72 processors. It's likely you have 72 hyperthreads, and actually have 36 cores, spread across 2 process (each processor having 18 cores each).

Try setting these environment variables and see if this helps:

```
# in your terminal, before running python / pytorch
NUM_CORES=18
export MKL_NUM_THREADS=$NUM_CORES OMP_NUM_THREADS=$NUM_CORES
python [your program]
```

Try the values `9, 18, 36` for `NUM_CORES`
